title.narrative: 00060191_Plan de Iniciacion 3aCNCC_v20100706 Final con anexos firmado
Tercera Comunicaci\xF3n Nacional de Cambio Clim\xE1tico

description.narrative: El objetivo es apoyar la preparación de la Tercera Comunicación Nacional de Cambio Climático
independent political entity

activity-description.narrative: Actividades de Apoyo para Preparar la Tercera Comunicación Nacional de Chile ante la Convención Marco de las Naciones Unidas sobre el Cambio Climátic

description.narrative: Número de temas claves identificados para incluir en la tercera comunicación

comment.narrative: Segunda comunicación preparada
Desarrollo de consultorías sectoriales específicas sobre vulnerabilidad y adaptación para ser incluidas en la Tercera Comunicación Nacional.

Estudio para la "Elaboración de propuesta de desarrollo de capacidades para el Plan de Acción Nacional de Cambio Climático" Apoyo al intercambio de experiencias mediante la participación de profesionales de la Oficina de Cambio Climático del Ministerio del Medio Ambiente en taller sobre la temática en Bonn (Alemania), Lima (Perú) y Asunción (Paraguay) También se ha apoyado con información el desarrollo de tesis universitarias, cuyos resultados serán utilizados en la Tercera Comunicación Nacional de Cambio Climático de Chile. Estudio para el análisis de la inclusión de medidas de mitigación estudiadas en el proyecto MAPS en el eje de mitigación del nuevo Plan de Acción Nacional de Cambio Climático 2016-2021.

Propuesta de capítulo “Vulnerabilidad del país y su Adaptación al Cambio Climático” para la Tercera Comunicación Nacional de Chile sobre Cambio Climático ante las Naciones Unidas” Elaboración de base digital del clima comunal de Chile: línea base (años 1980-2010) y proyección al año 2050” Preparación, edición e impresión del documento.

description.narrative: Programa para la difusión, promoción y profundización del marco normativo y conceptual de desarrollo humano
Programa para la difusión del marco conceptual y normativo de Desarrollo Humano
independent political entity

activity-description.narrative: Programa para la difusión, promoción y profundización del marco normativo y conceptual de desarrollo humano

description.narrative: Número de informes publicados y difundidos Número de artículos publicados Número de presentaciones realizadas Numero de reuniones con expertos Numero de propuestas temáticas preparadas

comment.narrative: Apropiación moderada del marco del desarrollo humano en las políticas públicas.

Informe sobre desarrollo Humano 2015 publicado y distribuido. Cincuenta presentaciones realizadas Material audiovisual del Informe preparado Esquema general del próximo IDH preparado Índices de Desarrollo Humano para las quince regiones del país publicados.

Lanzamiento en abril del Informe IDH 2015, en el palacio de La Moneda. Impresión de 1.500 ejemplares del libro. A noviembre de 2015 se han distribuido más de 1.300 ejemplares. La versión electrónica tiene más de 10.000 descargas. Más de 65 presentaciones del IDH 2015. Se prepararon varios materiales de difusión del IDH: una animación, un video y una serie de entrevistas, todo disponible en www.desarrollohumano.cl. El esquema general del IDH 2015 está preparado y se han comenzado a ejecutar los primeros estudios. Los índices de Desarrollo Humano a nivel de regiones están en su fase final de cálculo. Se está evaluando su publicación para el mes de diciembre (depende de si hará un evento de lanzamiento del IDH mundial).
Publicación y difusión de los Índices de Desarrollo Humano a nivel regional y a nivel comunal Cuatro estudios y/o investigaciones para el próximo Informe de Desarrollo Humano finalizadas
Se han publicado y difundido los Índices de Desarrollo Humano a nivel regional y a nivel comunal Se han elaborado uatro estudios y/o investigaciones para el próximo Informe de Desarrollo Humano

title.narrative: Especies Exoticas Invasoras: Piloto Arc Juan Fernandez

description.narrative: Especies Exoticas Invasoras: Piloto Archipiélago Juan Fernandez

title.narrative: Documento de proyecto Especies Exoticas Invasoras
Especies Exoticas Invasoras: Piloto Arc Juan Fernandez
Especies Exoticas Invasoras: Piloto Arc Juan Fernandez
Especies Exoticas Invasoras: Piloto Arc Juan Fernandez

description.narrative: Poner en funcionamiento marcos regulatorios nacionales y capacidades institucionales para controlar la introducción y propagación de Especies Exóticas Invasoras a través del comercio, turismo y transporte.
third-order administrative division
Environment - policy, planning and administration

National policy frameworks and institutional capacities are in place to control the introduction and spread of invasive alien species IAS through Trade Travel and Transport piloting surveillance and control measures in a high biodiversity environment threatened by IAS the Juan Fernandez archipelago
A system of surveillance of goods and visitors entering Chilean insular ecosystems and other vulnerable sites protects biodiversity from IAS impacts

comment.narrative: Existing surveillance system only covers external borders
Approved surveillance system in place in JFA 9500 ha and ready for implementation in other Chilean islands 39700 ha and priority protected areas tbd

The voluntary inspection system for preventing IAS entry into the JFA and their spread between these islands has been implemented successfully with CONAF SAG the JFA Municipality the Port Authority and the Police Force However by means of a commitment on the part of CONAF efforts are being made to obtain a legal mandate in the form of a resolution that will make control mandatory

description.narrative: Increase in funding for IAS including annual government budget allocations for IAS management in islands and protected areas and other sources such as the National Fund for Regional Development FNDR

comment.narrative:
SNASPE 2006479
SAG 23025023
MMA 187822
Others FNDR has one IAS management plan for Beavers

20 increase
SNASPE 2407775
SAG 27630028
MMA 225386
Others Target to be determined when funding gap for improved IAS management is established

The finalized version of the PEEI is a basic requirement for defining future IAS financing commitments Nonetheless substantial financing will be generated through drawing up and implementing the Regional IAS Action Plans which will be financed through regional funds FNDR as well as through Clean Production Agreements to be implemented with the trade transport and tourism sectors that serve the JFA This is in addition to what was reported in the 2014 PIR
The Municipality hired a professional to take charge of Environment issues and established a Township Environment Committee CAC which has been very positive for Project coordination and support

description.narrative: of protocols under implementation for species and sites prioritized in an approved Integrated National Program for the Control of Invasive Species PEEI

comment.narrative:
PEEI does not exist
Existing protocols only cover IAS that threaten economically important species
No blacklist of IAS that threated biodiversity
No priority sites for IAS management

PEEI approved by end of year 2
Protocols in PEEI cover IAS that threaten biodiversity
Blacklist for IAS that threaten biodiversity
Priority sites defined including islands and specific protected areas

The PEEI National Program for Prevention Control or Eradication of IASs is being drawn up jointly with the EMs Species Department There is already a Strategy approved by the COCEI and together with this entity the National Action Plan is being developed on the basis of the Strategys guidelines As part of the PEEI Regional Action Plans are being drawn up in Los Ríos Los Lagos Aysén and Magallanes The University of Chiles Center for Public Policies has been tendered the task of drawing up the four regional action plans and as part of the agreement with Island Conservation is drawing up the Action Plan for the Juan Fernández Island
The legislation for establishing the SBPA which was proposed including indications regarding control and management of IASs which affect biodiversity has entered into the process of congressional indications revision The Project is monitoring this process In addition the first national study is being carried out for Assessing the Economic Impact of a Group of Invasive Alien Species on productive sectors and on Biodiversity in Chile This outcome will serve as a precedent for increasing national awareness and for seeking financial mechanisms for IAS control in Chile
The University of Concepción has been awarded the contract for drawing up the first Catalogue of naturalized species in Chile including plants vertebrates invertebrates fungi and others
As part of the National IAS Program work is being carried out on prioritization of areas The Project has been working in particular on the Juan Fernández action plan as well as supporting the 4 regions where regional action plans will be carried out with specific actions such as for example the efforts for eradicating mink in Chiloé and Tierra del fuego In addition within the agreement with Island Conservation the possibility of replicating IAS control and management experiences on Mocha Island is being examined

description.narrative: Reduced IAS introduction rates as measured by of IAS newly discovered outside of the inspection facilities ie in the town of San Juan Bautista and nearby areas

comment.narrative: TBD year 1 of project

At least 301 reduction by end of project
1 reduction rate will be adjusted once baseline IAS introduction rates are confirmed
Since there is as yet no system of mandatory inspection and quarantine it is not possible to determine reduction rates for IAS introduction

description.narrative:
Strengthened Integrated Invasive species management at the national level as measured through the increase in total score of the IAS TT
Issue
1 Is there a National Coordination Mechanism to assist with the design and implementation of a national IAS strategy
2 Is there a National IAS strategy and is it being implemented
3 Has the national IAS strategy lead to the development and adoption of comprehensive framework of policies legislation and regulations across sectors
4 Have priority pathways for invasions been identified and actively managed and monitored
5 Are detection delimiting and monitoring surveys conducted on a regular basis
6 Are best management practices being applied in project target areas
TOTAL SCORE
TOTAL POSSIBLE

baseline total score for IAS that impact BD 103

According to Midterm TT
IASs which impact economic sectors
4352411929
IASs which impact biodiversity
210104 829
Beginning in this stage it is the Environment Ministrys Species Department who will be in charge of deciding on all matters regarding IAS strategies In the resolution which formalizes this the Operational Committee for Control of Invasive Alien Species COCEI is considered an advisory entity that will support the Species Department The Project is working jointly and developing that department to guarantee IAS action sustainability over time Awaiting approval of the proposed legislation for establishing the Service for Biodiversity and Protected Areas SBPA A first step was taken in establishing this Service when on 4 March in a constitutional proceedure the congress approved the projects main proposals and requested indications The Project has contributed to the SBPA legislation indications regarding IAS management and it is following up on these
The IAS Strategy was approved by the COCEI but it has not yet been approved by the Executive The Council of Ministers for Sustainability should endorse these documents to increase their impact
The Project jointly with the Species Department and COCEI are working on preparing the National Action Plan for Invasive Alien Species Management Pda_EEI by means of general workshops August 2015 where the activities proposed by the COCEI will be discussed on the basis of the strategic guidelines indicated in the National Strategy It should be pointed out that this Plan is part of the process of updating the National Biodiversity Strategy ENB and its Biological Diversity Strategic Plans 20112020 and has support from the BIOFIN and GEFIAS Projects
On April 14 2015 in a meeting with the SAG a commitment was formalized in which minutes were drawn up with participation of the following SAGs National Director Angel Sartori and their AgricultureForestry Division Chief Rodrigo Astete Natural Resources Division Chief Roberto Rojas and Department heads The intention is to develop official control of some IASs to be defined in a joint study between the Continent and the JFA a much better option than that proposed originally in the PRODOC of voluntary control establishing in this manner a regulatory mechanism which will be maintained over time including establishing infrastructure and institutionalization of the measure
Within the framework of the Project the first stage of voluntary IAS inspections was carried out between JFA islands from Robinson Crusoe to Alejandro Selkirk with support from CONAF SAG the JFA Municipality the Port Authority and the Police Force CONAF has commited itself to implementing this as a mandatory control in the islands of the Archipelago by means of an official resolution and this is a demonstration of Project support for establishing norms which will be stable over time
The first stage of the Clean Production Agreement CPA has been launched with the JFA tourism union involving the tourism transport and trade sectors The plan is to promote awareness knowledge behavior and actions that contribute to improving practices regarding the environment and prevent the introduction of IASs into the islands of this Archipelago A CPA is a voluntary agreement between a business association that represents a productive sector and the public entities competent in issues such as the environment health hygiene and job security water and energy efficiency and developing production whose objective is to apply Clean Production through specific targets and actions in a timeframe specified for achieving what has been agreed upon The objective of the CPAs is to improve productive and environmental conditions by seeking compliance with those environmental norms which tend to increase companies productivity and competitiveness www cplclAcuerdosAPL

description.narrative: A regulatory institutional and financial framework to combat IAS important for conservation of biodiversity is in place and operating

IAS management plans for other priority Chilean Islands Easter Island Desventuradas Islands Mocha Island Sala y Gomez Island
IAS strategy for Chiles National System of Protected Areas SNASPE

comment.narrative:
No IAS management plans exist
No IAS strategy exists for SNASPE

At least 2 plans drafted by end of project
Strategy drafted by end of project

Work is going forward on draft management plans for Juan Fernández and Mocha Island as part of the agreement with Island Conservation In addition to this the text of the Regional Plans will include supplementary information regarding Chiloé and Tierra del Fuego which although included in their respective Regional Plans will be provided with more precise Action Plan imputs for their specific characteristics as island territories In this second stage efforts will be carried out on the drafts of two additional Action Plans for Desventuradas and Mocha Islands
Together with CONAF guidelines have been drawn up on best practices in IAS management and control in both continental and island protected areas as well as the role that hiking trails play in these issues The consultancies that have been carried out have made available very high quality material for including IAS best practices in SNASPE area management plans an issue which must be taken up with CONAF during this phase

description.narrative:
Increased institutional capacity of key institutions CONAF SAG MMASNASPE Regional Authorities DIRECTEMAR Carabineros PDI IMJF to manage IAS detrimental to biodiversity as measured by
Updated technical procedures that address IAS SAG
New technical staff and competencies SNASPE
Regional planning procedures that incorporate IAS

comment.narrative:
SAG currently only applies inspection at borders and to species identified for economic interests
IAS is not included as a competency in SNASPE requirements and only 25 of staff have IAS understanding
Regional planning procedures and risk management do not cover IAS
There is no agreed upon IAS capacity development index for PEEI implementation and currently only 15 of staff in key institutions understand IAS issues

By end of project
SAG has developed specific technical procedures for species prioritized in the PEEI and at sites including the JFA and at least two other priority sites
IAS is included as a competency in SNASPE new SBAP staff requirements and at least 50 of staff have detailed knowledge and skills defined
Regional planning procedures and risk management include IAS
There is at least a 50 increase in the IAS capacity index above baseline established by end of year 1 for each of the following institutions CONAF SAG MMA Juan Fernandez Municipality

A consultancy drawn up jointly with SAG is being tendered for improving the present risk assessment system applied by SAG based on the Proceedure for Allowing Entry of Wild Fauna into the national territory along with another consultancy drawn up by SAG already awarded for compiling and organizing the information necessary to draw up a Risk Assessment of Infestations for the Juan Fernández Archipelago
The Midterm Evaluation recommended adding indicators for the institutionalization of outcomes where it was stipulated that an as yet undetermined number of professionals from the counterpart institutions be granted a Degree in IASs approved by a prestigious institution This was determined because during the first stage of the Project a study of existing interinstitutional capabilities was carried out with an education and training actions proposal including certification that would contribute to strengthening the Projects institutional sustainability and IAS policy continuity in Chile The terms of reference for this Degree are already being drawn up and it should be tendered this year A specific training event was the joint effort with CONAF regarding the Vespula germánica yellow jacket a training workshop was carried out for 30 park rangers on management and control for practical application in parks and reserves
Preparation of the regional plans for Los Ríos Los Lagos Aysén and Magallanes has been tendered The intention is to succeed in Incorporating IASs into regional planning and risk management
In order to improve knowledge and abilities regarding IASs within different public and private institutions the first conference on Private Areas and IASs in Chile was organized by the GEF Project with the participation of 70 people representing more than 30 private areas and with the Environment Minister the National SAG Director and the UNDP Environment and Energy Programme Officer present During the Conference a commitment was reached between the private concerns and the Project to advance with Product 14 regarding institutions and productive sectors in IAS management In addition we have available 1000 publications dealing with IASs on both the national and international levels including scientific papers chapters from books press releases among others These will help to complement the national data base that is currently being set up for the whole country

description.narrative: of targets in the officially approved annual workplan of the National Operating Committee for InterSectoral Control of IAS COCEI achieved by participating institutions MMA SAG CONAF MINAGRI SERNAPESCA SUBPESCA DIRECTEMAR FACH DINAMAR and Natural History Museum

comment.narrative:
COCEI operating without formal status or annual workplans
0

Legal instrument for COCEI with specific annual targets published by end of year 3
80 by end of project

The Project succeeded in obtaining formal establishment of the COCEI by means of the Environment Ministrys Exempt Resolution N 684 of 09 March 2013 The Project has sought to strengthen the COCEI in view of the roles it is assigned in the PRODOC However because of the COCEIs legal definition in practice it serves only as an advisory body This shortcoming could translate into a lack of institutional sustainability for the IAS policies strategies programs in Chile For this reason the Midterm Evaluation MTE recommended reinforcing that advisory role Until the SBPA legislation is finalized the EM Species Department will fill the executive role and together with the Council of Ministers for Sustainability review and approve policy documents regarding IASs With the Species Department playing a major role in drawing up the PEEI this constitutes successful effective institucionalization and appropriation of the Invasive Alien Species issues on the part of this Ministerial Department

description.narrative:
Strengthened regulatory system as measured by the inclusion of IAS management in at least the following instruments
Hunting Law Regulations
SBAP Law
Law for Special Island Territories Juan Fernandez Archipelago
Civil Aviation and Shipping regulations eg restrictions on imports of certain products increased inspections by airlines and shipping companies of their goods they transport SAG Exemption Resolutions etc
Tourism regulations restrictions on products carried by civil aviation and passenger ships to the JFA SAG Exemption Resolutions

comment.narrative: Text concerning management of IAS that impact biodiversity does not exist in any legal instruments or regulations governing relevant sectors in Chile
Text finalized and submitted to competent authorities for inclusion in the relevant legal instruments by end of year 1 and approved by end of project

Since general approval by the Senate of the proposed legislation for establishing the SBPA in March of this year the Project has contributed indications regarding IASs drawn up by specialized lawyers who were hired for this purpose within the relevant formal timeframe A consultancy has been financed regarding the existance of legal bodies analysing the national legal frameworks for IAS management in Chile However the Project can do np more than propose indications and then make them available to the Government and the legislative branch

description.narrative: Traveling public tourism operators importers and shipping agents aware of risks posed by IAS to vulnerable biodiversity

comment.narrative: No specific information targeting tourism operators importers and shipping agents In general little awareness of IAS detrimental to biodiversity
Agreements with all airlines and tourism operators that travel to the JFA and other Chilean islands to provide information on IAS to their passengers

Progress on these matters has been substantial with the tourism transport and trade operators who offer services in the JFA a CPA was signed which includes among other environmental issues that of IAS management This agreement was achieved between the UNDP the GEFIAS Project and the Executive Direction of the Economy Ministrys Clean Production Council
This is in addition to what was achieved in the previous period regarding information which the shipping companies must provide to their customers and regarding facilities granted to State entities for controlling IAS entry into the JFA from the Continent

description.narrative: Integrated IAS Control System in place as a pilot project in the Juan Fernandez Archipelago and developing tools and strategies to be replicated at the national level

A financed IAS Management Plan for the Juan Fernandez Archipelago under implementation as measured by
Approved plan
Increased financing at JFA level
Best management practices being applied in Juan Fernandez as measured by item 6 of the GEF TT for IAS applied in JFA

comment.narrative:
No plans for IAS management in the JFA exist
Financing
CONAF 284560
SAG 56832
Municipality 15673
Baseline Scores
IAS that impact econ sectors IAS that impact biodiversity
1 0

Initial plan approved by end of year 1 Final plan approved by end of project
40 increase
CONAF 398384
SAG 79565
Municipality 21942
Target Scores
IAS that impact econ sectors IAS that impact biodiversity
5 5

An initial JFA action plan is now available and this year those responsible must specify and validate these actions This action plan will be included in the PEEI which to date consists of a Strategy and a National Action Plan Once these are approved they will be presented to the Regional Government of the 5th Region to incorporate them into public policy and give them access to financing through the Regional Development Fund
With the JF Municipality hiring a professional in charge of these issues they have surpassed the committed value calculations will be given in detail at the end of this year
CONAF has made contributions in kind through management of the biosecurity barrier between islands the work of their lawyer on legislation for the exempt resolution and hiring seasonal workers The exact figures will be available by the end of 2015 SAG has been carrying out yellow jacket control operations for two years and they have developed activities on the Island and the Continent to set up the voluntary barrier and in training The commitment to set up a mandatory barrier will mean an increase in SAGs direct contributions for implementation and for hiring personnel a situation which will be reflected in the 2016 PIR International financing has been obtained about USD 400000 through a project presented by CABI with support from the GEFIAS Project for protecting the JFAs genetic heritage which is at the present time threatened by IASs In addition a cooperation agreement was signed with the Conservatory in Brest France for the purpose of jointly developing an endemic plant conservatory in the JFA The exact values of the commitment have not yet been determined because a new meeting is to be held in France for work on the action plan

description.narrative:
Control activities reduce populations of key aggressive IAS within the JFA and provide best practices and knowhow for upscaling and replication at other sites over the longterm
Control of invasive fauna rodents and flora reduces pressures on and expands available habitat for the Masafuera Rayadito leading to population increases of this critically endangered endemic species To be measured by the number of successful nesting boxes
Control of invasive blackberry and maqui that displace native species and disrupt ecological functioning in native forests on Alejandro Selkirk
Increased populations of endemic Juan Fernandez Hummingbird through control of invasive blackberry and maqui on Robinson Crusoe island as measured by the increase in the of successful nests
Control of yellow jacket Vespula germanica on Robinson Crusoe island Number of queens captured in bait traps

comment.narrative:
Number of successful Rayadito nesting boxes will be measured at start of control work
Masafuera Rayadito pop in the southern zone of Alejandro Selkirk is estimated 250 individuals
150 ha
Number of successful nest will be measured at start of blackberry conrtol work baseline number of hummingbirds is estimated at 400
of queens captured at start of 1st season

An increase in 20 of successful Rayadito nesting boxes by end of project
Reduced to 100 ha by end of project
Increase of 20 in successful nest of endemic hummingbird in the blackberry control area
80 reduction by end of project

Regarding nesting of the rayadito the actions taken did not prosper because the design of the nests was not adequate During the second stage adaptations of the design will be tested In addition efforts are being made to improve the baseline in order to estimate their population and tendencies The MTE recommended revising the biological indicators and the new one proposed for the Rayadito measures the use of the different nest unit designs
Regarding blackberry control this species has been reduced over a 4 ha surface area specifically in forest clearings In addition a maintenance process has been carried out elimination of propagators in a 12ha surface area on Robinson Crusoe The MTE suggests that the Project focus on highly effective and low cost control methods in order to provide replicable models rather than trying to cover a larger number of hectares The additional activities generated by changes to the indicator are being included in the new agreement with OIKONOS
As a lesson learned the Project has confirmed that it is impossible to control blackberry by the traditional methods utilized to date For this reason it has promoted the need for investigating biological control methods that would make effective control possible and so a multisectorial work group has been formed under the direction of CONAFs Biological Diversity Department and including participation of the following CONAF INIA CABI Center for Agricultural Bioscience International Austral University the EM FIA and the GEFIAS Project In the new agreement with OIKONOS we are seeing improvement in the efforts for improving the hummingbirds habitat in forest clearings through comparing the IASinvaded surface areas in clearings where different control methodologies have been applied This is the result of modifications to the biological indicators recommended in the MTE
Regarding the Vespula germánica yellow jacket progress has been made in drawing up a control strategy for the island However the MTE and the specialists suggest that it is necessary to seek a methodology to replace evaluation by capture of queens since this is not efficient The indicator must be revised

description.narrative: Early Warning System for IAS in the Juan Fernandez Archipelago with the participation of all key partners SAG CONAF IMJF and the inhabitants of San Juan Bautista

comment.narrative: No system or procedures exist for responding to new IAS entries into the JFA
Early Warning System is fully functional by midterm of project reduction in average time to implement response activities following alerts by end of project

1 In this second Project phase work has begun on drawing up Early Warning systems and proceedures The Project is presently working on a revision of methodologies in this area and a workshop will be held in November jointly financed by the Tantauco Park with representatives of the EM CONAF SAG NGOs and private protected areas for the purpose of developing a SAT protocol for island ecosystems In the specific case of the JFA a protocol is being drawn up together with CONAF
By the time of the next period the protocol should have been validated by the institutions and be operating on a trial basis on the island of Juan Fernández

description.narrative: of goods and visitors entering the JFA by sea and air that are subjected to IAS inspection procedures

comment.narrative: 100 by end of project

The inspection proceedures that are being implemented are voluntary and lack legal underpinnings Formalizing the inspection system is a task for public institutions SAG CONAF A formal commitment has been made by both of these institutions to proceed with legal formalization of the above

description.narrative: Reduction in the number of IAS flora species small incipient populations within the JFA and best practices for costeffective IAS management for replication at other sites in Chile

comment.narrative:
46 incipient invasive flora species on Robinson Crusoe area of San Juan Bautista and neighbouring lands within National Park
14 invasive flora species on Alejandro Selkirk area of Rada la Colonia

Eradication of 50 23 of incipient invasive flora species by end of project
Eradication of 50 7 invasive flora species by end of project

The incipient species eradication work both on Alejandro Selkirk and on Robinson Crusoe has been highly effective and we believe that the target will be met To the present we have succeeded in identifying locating and nearly eradicating 23 IASs in San Juan Bautista and 7 in Alejandro Selkirk In addition the work carried out by the NGOs OIKONOS and IC has been incorporated into the community awareness efforts through the Environmental Education and Awareness project with a Focus on Gender An anthropological study was carried out regarding the inhabitants concept of their environment nature and the institutions present on the Island which can serve as a diagnosis to support the awareness efforts in the JFA

title.narrative: Plan para la eliminación de los hidroclorofluorocarbonos

description.narrative: Plan de gestión para la eliminación de hidroclorofluorocarbonos (HCFC) en Chile

Lograr la reducción en el consumo de los hidroclorofluorocarbonos (HCFC), cumpliendo las metas del Protocolo de Montreal para los años 2013 y 2015.
independent political entity
Energy - policy, planning and administration
- Número de técnicos capacitados en BPR. - Número de técnicos certificados. - Número de proyectos demostrativos de reconversión ejecutados. - Número de informes de seguimiento (monitoreo) aprobados

comment.narrative: - Inexistencia de un Programa de apoyo al sector refrigeración (servicio y mantenimiento) definido. - Inexistencia de un programa de monitoreo

Al menos 16 cursos de capacitación en BPR para técnicos completados. Al menos 1 proyecto de reconversión demostrativo implementado. Propuesta de centro de recuperación, reciclaje y regeneración de HCFC diseñado y aprobado. Identificación de alternativas de HCFC - 141b en actividades de limpieza.

N° técnicos capacitados: - 307 técnicos en BPR (5 regiones; 12 cursos) - 39 técnicos en flushing (1 región; 2 cursos) - 2 técnicos capacitados (Alemania, 2 cursos) N° técnicos certificados: 90 técnicos certificados por el CECCL de la CChRyC y Chilevalora Propuesta de centro de recuperación, reciclaje y regeneración de HCFC elaborada Identificación de alternativas al HCFC-141b en actividades de limpieza y capacitaciones realizadas

description.narrative: Continuar con la alianza entre el Ministerio de Desarrollo Social (ex Ministerio de Planificación) y el Programa de las Naciones Unidas para el Desarrollo que han llevado cabo desde el año 2007 al 2012.
independent political entity

activity-description.narrative: Apoyo al fortalecimiento de la red de protección y promoción social para la reducción de la pobreza, la vulnerabilidad y las desigualdades

description.narrative: Social Protection, Land Housing and Community Amenities - policy, planning and administration

- Número de minutas o documentos de trabajo elaborados y validados - Cantidad, calidad y pertinencia de los indicadores de bienestar propuestos. - Número de seminarios realizados. - Número y variedad de asistentes a los seminarios realizados. - Instrumento de focalización revisado y validado. - Número de propuestas de medición de variables

comment.narrative: -El Ministerio solicitó el apoyo de PNUD a través del proyecto que precede al actual para reformular la encuesta CASEN. -El Observatorio de la Realidad Social aun se encuentra en etapa de recopilación de encuestas, bases de datos, publicación de indicadores, etc. - La metodología para la medición de la pobreza está desactualizada y no cuenta con la credibilidad de los agentes. - No hay indicadores ni mediciones estándar para la medición de la desigualdad ni otras variables socioeconómicas relevantes.

Acompañamiento y análisis preliminar de la puesta en marcha del nuevo instrumento de focalización de usuarios de programas sociales Acompañamiento a la encuesta CASEN en el levantamiento de información para la versión 2015. Análisis sobre las nuevas mediciones que el Ministerio implementó en la versión 2013 de la encuesta CASEN.

Acompañamiento a la implementación del instrumento de focalización que entró en noviembre de 2015 Asesoría y apoyo técnico en el instrumento de focalización del programa Seguridades y Oportunidades. Acompañamiento y participación en la mesa de seguimiento y apoyo de la encuesta CASEN
Índice de pobreza multidimensional calculado con SAE (Small Area Estimation) disponible Nuevo instrumento de focalización acompañado técnicamente en su implementación y evaluación

El Índice aún no está disponible; se trabajó en replicar el SAE por ingresos sin éxito y se ha optado por contratar a un expero internacional para que desarrolle metodología ad hoc en 2017 El instrumento entró en vigencia a principios del cuarto trimestre de 2016, por lo que se encuentra en marcha blanca; se está diseñando el plan de acompañamiento del instrumento de focalización.

description.narrative: Energy - policy, planning and administration

Número y tipo de territorios críticamente amenazados que hayan sido restaurados, mantenidos, mejorados Número de mecanismos de gobernanza de múltiples actores (PGTMA) establecidos y operacionales a nivel de territorio y de la ecoregión (Comité de Socios) Está funcionando un nuevo mecanismo de financiamiento a cargo del MMA para apoyar las actividades de gestión territorial Número de proyectos impulsados por la comunidad financiados para la conservación de la biodiversidad, servicios del ecosistema y de monitoreo de la captura de carbono

comment.narrative: Existen tres iniciativas de escala territorial en la Ecoregión Mediterránea, pero carecen de políticas coherente, estructuras de apoyo en el manejo y seguimiento de conocimientos y un mecanismo específico de apoyo en el sistema público. Utilizando instrumentos no específicos, son capaces de producir beneficios ambientales mundiales reducidos El FPA financia proyectos pequeños y produce efectos insuficientes Existen 105 diferentes instrumentos públicos para el financiamiento de proyectos que persiguen objetivos relacionados con los BAM
Al menos 2 mecanismos de gobernanza de múltiples actores (PGTMA) establecidos y operacionales a nivel de territorio y de la ecoregión (Comité de Socios)

Establecidos y operativos 2 mecanismos de gobernanza de múltiples actores, correspondientes a las regiones de O'Higgins (Bosque Modelo Cachapoal) y Araucanía (Bosque Modelo Araucarias del Alto Malleco) Se está trabajando en un tercer territorio (Alhué). Se identifica un nuevo territorio (región del BíoBío) en el que se iniciarán jornadas de trabajo con la comunidad.
Financiación de 10 proyectos comunitarios 5 Iniciativas de Escala Territorial en funcionamiento 6 comunidades de práctica implementadas

5 proyectos comunitarios financiados 5 Iniciativas de Escala Territorial están en funcionamiento en mayor o menor escala 2 comunidades de práctica en funcionamiento: la Apícola de Curacautín en La Araucanía y la de Agroecología de San Nicolas en Biobío. La comunidad de práctica de genero tuvo una primera reunión este año pero no ha continuado por el momento.

Diseño
Energy - policy, planning and administration
Programa de fortalecimiento de capacidades en Energías Renovables No Convencionales (ERNC) a nivel regional y local

Diseñar e implementar Programa de Fortalecimiento de Capacidades Locales para la formulación, administración, operación y mantenimiento de proyectos de Energías Renovables No Convencionales a pequeña escala
Energy - power generation

Número de variables/criterios de selección considerados Número de comunas analizadas Número de instituciones que participan en el diseño Número de personas que mejoran su acceso a fuentes renovables de energía. Número de comunas que participan en el piloto Número de instituciones que participan en el piloto Numero de regiones y comunas considerados en el Plan de Acción a nivel nacional Número de acciones/documentos de difusión realizadas

comment.narrative: Informe de brechas elaborado por la empresa Poch en febreo de 2012 No existe un un programa piloto y experiencia demostrativa para el fortalecimiento de capacidades para la aplicación de ERNC a pequeña escala en las regiones objetivo No existe Plan de Acción a nivel nacional, a partir de las experiencias y lecciones de los programas piloto realizados en las regiones objetivo.

Diagnóstico elaborado y validado Cinco audiencias públicas realizadas a lo largo del país. Al menos cinco personas y cinco organizaciones consultadas en cada audiencia. Cinco mil encuestas respondidas y recibidas.

En elaboración el estudio de diagnóstico de las 2 regiones involucradas (9 comunas correspondientes a la región de Antofagasta y 12 de la región de los Ríos, en total 21 comunas) e iniciando la conformación de las mesas de trabajo regionales que estarán integradas por aproximadamente 8 instituciones en cada región 6 audiencias públicas (Antofagasta, Concepción, Puerto Montt, Punta Arenas, Valparaíso y Santiago) realizadas 130 personas y 90 instituciones consultadas en cada audiencia Aproximadamente 8900 personas respondieron a la encuesta
Diseño e implementación y evaluación de un Programa Piloto para el fortalecimiento de capacidades para la aplicación de ERNC a pequeña escala (a ejecutar integramente durante 2016)
El Programa Piloto fue diseñado e implementado en 2 regiones, con participación del 50% de las comunas y al menos el 65% de las instituciones identificadas como relevantes.

description.narrative: Fondo Forestal Ambiental diseñado Número de precursores de la degradación de bosques y/o deforestación abordados en el Fondo Forestal Ambiental (FFA) Número de instituciones locales y comunitarias que participan en el diseño del Fondo en las áreas piloto Número de mecanismos nacionales e internacionales incluidos en el diseño técnico, administrativo y financiero del FFA bajo el marco de la Estrategia de Chile Número de pequeños y medianos propietarios que ejecutan actividades estratégicas que reduzcan la degradación forestal y/o deforestación y que aumenten los sumideros de carbono Número de hectáreas intervenidas con actividades estratégicas actividades estratégicas que reduzcan la degradación forestal y/o deforestación y que aumenten los sumideros de carbono Toneladas de CO2eq no emitidas o capturadas a través de la ejecución de actividades estratégicas que reduzcan la degradación forestal y/o deforestación y que aumenten los sumideros de carbono Número de talleres con pequeños y medianos propietarios de tierras forestales informados, capacitados e incluidos en el diseño participativo de actividades estratégicas que reduzcan la degradación forestal y/o deforestación y que aumenten los sumideros de carbono Número de talleres con funcionarios de CONAF y otras instituciones relevantes capacitados para para la administración y gestión local del FFA en las áreas piloto Número de países LAC con los que Chile intercambia las lecciones aprendidas de la implementación de FFA Número de documentos que planteen necesidades operacionales y financieras en el marco del FFA en el marco de la CMNUCCC

comment.narrative: No existe en el país una estructura financiera que permita la distribución de beneficios y pagos por resultados asociados a la reducción de emisiones e incrementeo de la captura de gases de efecto invernadero de bosques y plantaciones de medianos y pequeños propietarios.
Diseño del Fondo Forestal Ambiental avanzado.

No se ha podido avanzar en el diseño del Fondo ya que la licitación para el consorcio de empresas/instituciones nacionales e internacionales que debería diseñar el Fondo se declaró desierta ya que la propuesta económica del único oferente que se presentó superó el presupuesto disponible. Se ha vuelto a generar el proceso de licitación y se extendió la duración del proyecto mediante una Revisión Sustantiva.
Herramienta de Fondo Forestal Ambiental diseñada
Herramienta de Fondo Forestal Ambiental diseñada y en proceso de implementación de pilotos

El proyecto tiene como objetivo desarrollar, sistematizar y proponer una definición de Pobreza energética, determinar cuáles son los elementos y necesidades básicas que la energía debe satisfacer a nivel nacional.

title.narrative: Programa para impulsar la participación electoral

description.narrative: Esta iniciativa se centrará en mejorar la sensibilización y comprensión del proceso electoral; diseñar e implementar acciones estratégicas de promoción de la participación electoral, y monitorear el nivel de representación electoral de las mujeres.
Este proyecto se propone mejorar el apoyo público a las elecciones presidenciales y parlamentarias a realizarse durante el último trimestre del año 2017.
